1553138703_12gAes6NzDS9E2q6Q1UXrpUdbPS6n.body:
> [innocentchild](#comment_10_1Gsi9eT29B2uDs5bgE8av17QJe4hZotADa): Icons don't work in any of my firefox browsers.

So I don't think this happens with standard Firefox (all icons work just fine with mine) but it definitely does happen in Tor Browser (and I wouldn't be surprised if tweaking Firefox's privacy settings produced the same result).

Basically I've noticed the same issue with my own sites in the past. It really comes down to ZeroNet not applying permissive Access Control headers for font/css files when there's a mismatch between the HTTP referrer and the content you're trying to access.

The code is [here](https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/blob/7bff5f562c42a4a5f73e104c0f767c1413064aa6/src/Ui/UiRequest.py#L431-L436) and basically in some cases that regex isn't doing what we want it to.

I'll send a PR later today to fix it, but with the current untested fix I'm able to get icons working on default Tor browser config.

To achieve the same result, add the following lines to `src/Ui/UiRequest.py` at line 515:

```
        if url_a.startswith(url_b) or url_b.startswith(url_a):
            return True
```

just after `return False`. Restart ZeroNet and see if things work after that.
